author: sky.cactus
content: For the *primary* key, you want something that can be used regularly and quickly but is incredibly resilient to theft (at the cost of being at risk of loss).  A hardware wallet with wipe-on-tamper casing and code is a good solution here.

The only possible way to bypass this is if the private key was compromised and they also have the credentials to re-identify the currency before transferring it to themselves.
